channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-5878] Use getVisibleLength public api from HdfsDataInputStream from Hadoop-2.
item.description:
SequencFileLogReader:

Currently Hbase using getFileLength api from DFSInputStream class by reflection. DFSInputStream is not exposed as public. So, this may change in future. Now HDFS exposed HdfsDataInputStream as public API.
We can make use of it, when we are not able to find the getFileLength api from DFSInputStream as a else condition. So, that we will not have any sudden surprise like we are facing today.

Also, it is just logging one warn message and proceeding if it throws any exception while getting the length. I think we can re-throw the exception because there is no point in continuing with dataloss.


long adjust = 0;



          try {

            Field fIn = FilterInputStream.class.getDeclaredField("in");

            fIn.setAccessible(true);

            Object realIn = fIn.get(this.in);

            // In hadoop 0.22, DFSInputStream is a standalone class.  Before this,

            // it was an inner class of DFSClient.

            if (realIn.getClass().getName().endsWith("DFSInputStream")) {

              Method getFileLength = realIn.getClass().

                getDeclaredMethod("getFileLength", new Class<?> []{});

              getFileLength.setAccessible(true);

              long realLength = ((Long)getFileLength.

                invoke(realIn, new Object []{})).longValue();

              assert(realLength >= this.length);

              adjust = realLength - this.length;

            } else {

              LOG.info("Input stream class: " + realIn.getClass().getName() +

                  ", not adjusting length");

            }

          } catch(Exception e) {

            SequenceFileLogReader.LOG.warn(

              "Error while trying to get accurate file length.  " +

              "Truncation / data loss may occur if RegionServers die.", e);

          }



          return adjust + super.getPos();
item.summary: Use getVisibleLength public api from HdfsDataInputStream from Hadoop-2.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
We can make use of it, when we are not able to find the getFileLength api from DFSInputStream as a else condition. So, that we will not have any sudden surprise like we are facing today.

+1 on this idea.
Thanks a lot for your opinion, Jieshan. Let me create a patch for it.

Uma Maheswara Rao G did you create a patch for this?

Looking at HDFS-3184 umbrella it seems that it's mostly done and given we're removing support for older versions of hadoop I guess we can (and should) refactor this.

Patch for master branch.
Please review and share your thoughts.

Is getFileLength same as getVisibleLength? What is minimum hadoop that has this API? Thanks.

How about just letting the exception out:

120 SequenceFileLogReader.LOG.warn("Error while trying to get accurate file length. "
121 + "Truncation / data loss may occur if RegionServers die.", e);

Since it is dataloss (as suggested above by Uma Maheswara Rao G?)

Otherwise patch looks good.

Thanks Stack for looking into this.

Is getFileLength same as getVisibleLength?

Yes. Internally getVisibleLength calls getFileLength.

What is minimum hadoop that has this API?

As per HDFS-3282, it is 2.0.0-alpha

How about just letting the exception out

Addressed in v2 patch.

@Stack can you please review v3 patch.

Will it ever enter the top of the if statement?

Here DFS is uppercase.

.endsWith("DFSInputStream")

However here it's lowercase dfs.

hdfsDataInputStream = (HdfsDataInputStream) this.getWrappedStream();

Thanks Elliott Clark for the review.

Will it ever enter the top of the if statement?

Nope, it wasn't. My bad
Corrected the logic in v4 patch. Please review

What's the dependency on HDFS-3184 – is that really a dependency before we commit this?

I believe the dependency we had was to get a publicly exposed api. Which was done as part of one of the sub task from HDFS-3184 and we are using that in this patch.
(sent from mobile excuse if any typos)
It would be good to update the dependency to the specific JIRA so as to avoid confusion for lookers-on.
Done.
Thanks Ashish Singhi. Patch applies, builds cleanly on branch-1 as well. I will commit this tomorrow unless there are specific objections.
Dropping 1.0, 1.1, and 1.2 from fix targets as I don't see this as a bug fix, more of a code-smell cleanup. Enis Soztutar/Andrew Purtell, Sean Busbey speak up if you think I have that wrong.
Patch applies mostly cleanly to 0.98, attaching here. You want this back ported Andrew Purtell?

Dropping this < 1.3 is fine by me Nick Dimiduk.

What about taking in a modified patch that just rethrows the exception? 


-       } catch(Exception e) {		

-          SequenceFileLogReader.LOG.warn(		

-            "Error while trying to get accurate file length.  " +		

-            "Truncation / data loss may occur if RegionServers die.", e);

Andrew Purtell, we cannot throw the exception as is, as the method is overridden from FSDataInputStream which throws IOE.
I can wrap the exception in a new IOE and throw that, is this ok for all the fix versions ? Just want confirm it before I attach a new patch.

I can wrap the exception in a new IOE and throw that, is this ok for all the fix versions

That could work. What do you think Nick Dimiduk ? Continuing after likely data loss seems like a bug.

I missed this before:

Patch applies mostly cleanly to 0.98, attaching here. You want this back ported Andrew Purtell?

Sure, we can take this change there

Continuing after likely data loss seems like a bug

Agreed. Better safe than sorry, better to throw the exception.

Thanks for comments Andrew and Nick.
Updated master patch.
Updated 0.98 branch patch

Pushed the v6 master patch to master, branch-1, and branch-1.2. Pushed the v1 branch-1.0 patch to branch-1.0 and branch-1.1. Pushed the v7 0.98 patch to 0.98 (checked Hadoop 1 and 2 builds). WAL unit tests pass all.
Missed TestHLog because it's outside of o.a.h.h.regionserver.wal.* . I'm going to revert the 0.98 commit. Let's just forget about it there.

I reverted the 0.98 patch from 0.98 and applied the branch-1.0 patch there instead, so the result here is the new changes from branch-1.2 and up, only the one line change to rethrow an exception if we fail to read the file length from branch-1.1 back. I think that's a good outcome.
